cs195n
Class CS195NFrontEnd

java.lang.Object
  cs195n.CS195NFrontEnd
Direct Known Subclasses:
SwingFrontEnd
public abstract class CS195NFrontEnd
extends java.lang.Object

Superclass for front-ends. At the moment the only concrete implementation is SwingFrontEnd, but someday we may have a GLFrontEnd.

    Student subclass responsibilities:
    • Override all on*** methods.
    Support code subclass responsibilities:
    • After call to super(), either go fullscreen or create a window such that the drawable area is equal to windowedSize.
    • Implement all do*** methods and make them final.
    • Ensure all on*** methods are called appropriately.
    • Ensure no variables or methods are accidentally exposed to student subclasses.

    Author:
    zdavis

    Field Detail

    DEFAULT_WINDOW_SIZE

    static final Vec2i DEFAULT_WINDOW_SIZE
    The default window size; should be passed to the constructor if the user does not specify a window size.

    MINIMUM_WINDOW_SIZE

    static final Vec2i MINIMUM_WINDOW_SIZE
    The minimum window size. Games are expected to work with resolutions at least this small; smaller resolutions will not be tested or graded, and the window should not allow itself to be resized any smaller than this.

    fullscreen

    boolean fullscreen

    windowedSize

    Vec2i windowedSize

    running

    volatile boolean running

    debug

    boolean debug
    Constructor Detail

    CS195NFrontEnd

    CS195NFrontEnd(boolean fullscreen,
               Vec2i windowSize)
    Constructor. Note that this currently just stores the values; subclasses should actually create a window or go fullscreen after this based on the values of fullscreen and windowSize.

    Parameters:
    fullscreen - true for starting in fullscreen, false for starting in a window
    windowSize - the starting window size
    Method Detail

    onTick

    protected abstract void onTick(long nanosSincePreviousTick)
    Called at a regular interval set by setTickFrequency(long). Use to update any state that changes over time.

    Parameters:
    nanosSincePreviousTick - approximate number of nanoseconds since the previous call to onTick

    onDraw

    protected abstract void onDraw(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
    Called when the screen needs to be redrawn. This is at least once per tick, but possibly more frequently (for example, when the window is resizing).

    Note that the entire drawing area is cleared before each call to this method. Furthermore, onResize(cs195n.Vec2i) is guaranteed to be called before the first invocation of onDraw.

    Parameters:
    g - a Graphics2D object used for drawing.

    onResize

    protected abstract void onResize(Vec2i newSize)
    Called when the size of the drawing area changes. Any subsequent calls to onDraw should note the new size and be sure to fill the entire area appropriately. Guaranteed to be called before the first call to onDraw.

    Parameters:
    newSize - the new size of the drawing area.

    startup

    public final void startup()
    Begin processing events. None of the on*** methods will be called before this is called.

    shutdown

    public final void shutdown()
    Stop processing events. Since there may already be events pending, a few on*** methods may be called even after this is called.

    Calling this method is not strictly necessary, but useful if you want to close the front-end without exiting the program (e.g. if you write a map editor that directly launches the game).

    isRunning

    public final boolean isRunning()
    Returns whether or not events are currently being processed (specifically, if startup() has been called without a corresponding call to shutdown()).

    Returns:
    true if the front-end is running, false if not

    setFullscreen

    public final void setFullscreen(boolean fullscreen)
    Switches the front-end between fullscreen and windowed.

    Parameters:
    fullscreen - true for fullscreen, false for windowed

    isFullscreen

    public final boolean isFullscreen()
    Gets whether the front-end is currently fullscreen or windowed.

    Returns:
    true if the fullscreen is currently set, false if windowed

    setDebugMode

    public final void setDebugMode(boolean debug)
    Enable or disable debug mode. When debug mode is enabled, the current size of the draw area and aspect ratio is displayed in the title of the window along with the current FPS count, and pressing F12 will bring up a dialog to resize the window.

    Parameters:
    debug - true to enable debug mode, false to disable

    isDebugMode

    public final boolean isDebugMode()
    Gets whether debug mode is currently set.

    Returns:
    true if the debug mode is currently on, false if not

    setTickFrequency

    public final void setTickFrequency(long nanoDelay)
    Controls the frequency of onTick() calls. Ticks will occur approximately once every nanoDelay nanoseconds, but no specific accuracy guarantees can be made. Always use the argument of onTick to determine the actual amount of time passed.

    Parameters:
    nanoDelay - the number of nanoseconds between the start of each ticks. For example, for 50 FPS, this value would be 1000000000/50 (20000000). Must be >= 0.

    doSetTickFrequency

    abstract void doSetTickFrequency(long nanoDelay)
    Actually set the tick frequency. nanoDelay is guaranteed to be valid (>= 0).

    doSetFullscreen

    abstract void doSetFullscreen()
    Actually run code to go fullscreen or windowed. The fullscreen field will hold the value of the desired new state. When returning from fullscreen back to windowed, it's nice if the subclass remembers the old window size and position, but this behavior is not strictly required.

    doSetDebugMode

    abstract void doSetDebugMode()
    Actually run code to enable or disable debug mode. The debug field will hold the value of the desired new state.

    doStartup

    abstract void doStartup()
    Actually run code to start up. NO EVENTS SHOULD BE DELIVERED BEFORE THIS IS CALLED IN CASE THE USER WANTS TO DO SETUP.

    doShutdown

    abstract void doShutdown()
    Actually run code to shut down.
